DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
        Off [0]
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SPEED]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
          Off [0]
    Enable Oscillation [OSC_ON]
    Disable Oscillation [OSC_OFF]
    Set Timer [TIMER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the living room fan, set its speed to 3, enable oscillation, and set a timer for 45 minutes?

First, I identify the commands needed to fulfill the user's request based on the device structure. The user wants to turn on the fan, set speed to 3, enable oscillation, and set a timer for 45 minutes.

- To turn on the fan, use the Turn On [ON] command.
- To set speed to 3 (within the 0-5 range), use Set Speed [SPEED] with parameter 3.
- To enable oscillation, use Enable Oscillation [OSC_ON].
- To set a timer for 45 minutes (within 0-120), use Set Timer [TIMER] with parameter 45.

Result: Execute commands in sequence: ON, SPEED(3), OSC_ON, TIMER(45) to meet the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Kitchen Smart Light Strip
  ***Properties***
    Brightness
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    Color Temperature
      Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Power State
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POFF]
    Set Brightness [SBRT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
          Off [0]
    Set Color Temperature [SCT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
I want to brighten the kitchen light strip to 80% and set the color temperature to 4000 Kelvin. How do I do that?

The device accepts commands to set brightness and color temperature with specific ranges: brightness from 0 to 100%, and color temperature from 2700 to 6500 Kelvin.

To brighten the light strip to 80%, use the Set Brightness [SBRT] command with parameter 80.

To set the color temperature to 4000 K, use the Set Color Temperature [SCT] command with parameter 4000.

Result: Send SBRT(80) and SCT(4000) commands to adjust brightness and color temperature as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Master Bedroom Window Shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Tilt Angle
      Range 0 to 180 Unit degrees
    Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        Moving [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Shade [OPEN]
    Close Shade [CLOSE]
    Set Position [SETPOS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Tilt [SETTILT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 180 Unit degrees
    Stop Movement [STOP]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Could you partially open the bedroom shade to 60% and tilt the slats to 45 degrees?

The device supports setting the shade position from 0 to 100% and tilt angle from 0 to 180 degrees.

To partially open the shade to 60%, use the Set Position [SETPOS] command with parameter 60.

To tilt the slats to 45 degrees, use the Set Tilt [SETTILT] command with parameter 45.

Result: Execute SETPOS(60) and SETTILT(45) commands to achieve the requested shade position and tilt angle.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door currently locked and closed? If not, please close and lock it.

First, I check the Door Status property which can be Closed, Open, Opening, or Closing, and the Lock Status which can be Locked or Unlocked.

If the door is not Closed, I will send the Close Door [CLOSE] command.

If the door is not Locked, I will send the Lock Door [LOCK] command.

Result: If the door is open or moving, send CLOSE command; if unlocked, send LOCK command to ensure the garage door is closed and locked.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Sprinkler Controller
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit liters_per_minute
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [START]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 6 Unit Zone Number
    Stop Zone [STOP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 6 Unit Zone Number
    Enable Schedule [EN_SCH]
    Disable Schedule [DIS_SCH]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Please start watering zone 3 and enable the schedule for the sprinkler system.

The device accepts commands to start and stop watering specific zones numbered 1 to 6, and to enable or disable the watering schedule.

To start watering zone 3, use the Start Zone [START] command with parameter 3.

To enable the schedule, use the Enable Schedule [EN_SCH] command.

Result: Send START(3) to begin watering zone 3 and EN_SCH to enable the schedule as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Usage
      Range 0 to 100 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the water heater and set the temperature to 55 degrees Celsius?

The device supports turning on/off and setting temperature between 30 and 75 °C.

To turn on the water heater, use the Turn On [ON] command.

To set the temperature to 55 °C, use the Set Temperature [SET_TEMP] command with parameter 55.

Result: Execute ON command followed by SET_TEMP(55) to turn on the heater and set the desired temperature.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

Please enable motion detection and night vision on the security camera, and start recording.

The device supports enabling/disabling motion detection and night vision, and starting/stopping recording.

To enable motion detection, use Enable Motion Detection [MD_ON].

To enable night vision, use Enable Night Vision [NV_ON].

To start recording, use Start Recording [REC_START].

Result: Send MD_ON, NV_ON, and REC_START commands to enable motion detection, night vision, and start recording as requested.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:

    Open Door Alert On [ALERT_ON]
    Open Door Alert Off [ALERT_OFF]

    Ice Maker Off [ICE_OFF]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the refrigerator temperature to 4 degrees Celsius and turn on the ice maker?

The refrigerator allows setting internal temperature between 1 and 10 °C and turning the ice maker on or off.

To set temperature to 4 °C, use Set Temperature [SET_TEMP] with parameter 4.

To turn on the ice maker, use Ice Maker On [ICE_ON].

Result: Execute SET_TEMP(4) and ICE_ON commands to set the temperature and activate the ice maker as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bathroom Exhaust Fan
  ***Properties***
    Fan Speed
      Range 0 to 3 Unit Level
        Off [0]
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 60 Unit minutes
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SET_SPEED]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 3 Unit Level
    Set Timer [SET_TIMER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 60 Unit minutes
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the bathroom fan, set it to high speed, and run it for 15 minutes.

The device supports turning on/off, setting fan speed from 0 to 3 (with 3 as high), and setting a timer up to 60 minutes.

To turn on the fan, use Turn On [ON].

To set speed to high, use Set Speed [SET_SPEED] with parameter 3.

To run for 15 minutes, use Set Timer [SET_TIMER] with parameter 15.

Result: Send ON, SET_SPEED(3), and SET_TIMER(15) commands to fulfill the user's request.
